text:
(1)
Fort Hamilton Parkway, west side, between 100th and 101st Streets. showing the home of Colonel James C. Church, who was postmaster in 1838. His son Judge Charles W. Church lived here until his death in 1915.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, showing the north side of the house.
October 1928.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3)
The same, showing the south side of the house.
October 1928.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

For complete data see New York Times of April 10, 1938.

title: Brooklyn: Fort Hamilton - 100th Street

text:
100th Street, at the N.W. corner of Fort Hamilton Parkway.

June 9, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
